alert.note: Alert for Edgecombe; Johnston; Wayne; Wilson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 5:12PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Wayne, southwestern Edgecombe, Wilson and southeastern Johnston Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 512 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles south of Bailey to 10 miles west of Goldsboro. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Goldsboro, Tarboro, Wilson, Elm City, Fremont, Sharpsburg, Pinetops, Kenly, Princeton and Lucama. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
